items.title: Landscape (sketch)
items.Transcript:
[[A sketch of a landscape with sun on the horizon]]
{{Alt: There's a river flowing through the ocean}}
items.Alt: There's a river flowing through the ocean

items.title: Petit Trees (sketch)
items.Transcript:
[[Two trees are growing on opposite sides of a sphere.]]
{{Alt-title: 'Petit' being a reference to Le Petit Prince, which I only thought about halfway through the sketch}}
items.Alt: 'Petit' being a reference to Le Petit Prince, which I only thought about halfway through the sketch

items.title: Serenity is coming out tomorrow
items.Transcript:
[[Several stick figures stand side by side in a lineup. A forlorn male in a coat, a male with combed hair, a male with spiky hair and arms outstretched enthusiastically, a female with long hair and cornrows, a shorter female with stringy hair falling over her face, an enthusiastic female with arms raised in celebration with shorter hair, a male with short hair and a goatee, a female with curly hair wearing a dress, and a stern-looking man with flyaway hair. There is no dialogue.]] 
{{Alt: Mal, Simon, Wash, Zoe, River, Kaylee, Jayne, Inara, Book.}}
items.Alt: Mal, Simon, Wash, Zoe, River, Kaylee, Jayne, Inara, Book.

items.title: Barrel - Part 1
items.Transcript:
[[A boy sits in a barrel which is floating in an ocean.]]
Boy: I wonder where I'll float next?
[[The barrel drifts into the distance. Nothing else can be seen.]]
{{Alt: Don't we all.}}

items.title: Blown apart
items.Transcript:
[[A black number 70 sees a red package.]]
70: hey, a package!
[[The package explodes with a <<BOOM>> and a red cloud of smoke.]]
[[There are a red 7, a green 5 and a blue 2 lying near a scorched mark on the floor.]]
{{alt text: Blown into prime factors}}

items.title: Girl sleeping (Sketch -- 11th grade Spanish class)
items.Transcript: [[Girl sleeping on her side, facing away from view]]
items.Alt: I don't remember her name at all, but she fell asleep on the floor in front of me.

items.title: Irony
items.Transcript:
Narrator: When self-reference, irony, and meta-humor go too far
Narrator: A CAUTIONARY TALE
Man 1: This statement wouldn't be funny if not for irony!
Man 1: ha ha
Man 2: ha ha, I guess.
Narrator: 20,000 years later...
[[desolate badlands landscape with an imposing sun in the sky]]
{{It's commonly known that too much perspective can be a downer.}}
items.Alt: It's commonly known that too much perspective can be a downer.

items.title: Red spiders
items.Transcript:
[[Many red spiders standing on and hanging from cuboids. The cuboids hang in the air with no visible means of support.]]
{{They are six-legged spiders}}

items.title: Pi Equals
items.Alt: My most famous drawing, and one of the first I did for the site
